title: Mods need to cut the bullshit and stop deleting gameplay threads about gameplay
body:
When people make legit threads about the JG XP sucking and you just delete them for no reason and give us this canned bullshit response it doesn't help

>It's hyperbole.

No it's fact you don't even play this game how can you even say this?

>It provides zero basis for discussion (see responses to it).

BULLSHIT YOU JUST HATE THE TOPIC AND HAVE NO VALID RESPONSES SO YOU DELETE IT.

 >It makes zero effort to define the problem (What has changed? How often are junglers behind? Why are junglers behind? Which junglers are struggling?).

BULLSHIT THE PROBLEM IS JUNGLE XP TOO LOW BECAUSE IT WAS NERFED AND TOP AND MID WERE BUFFED AND IT'S TOO HIGH CREATING A MASSIVE ROLE IMBALANCE IN THE GAME. THE PROBLEM DEFINE IS DEFINED. WHAT YOU SAID IS A BUNCH OF BULLSHIT

 >It fails to analyze anything (How might the problem be addressed without causing other problems like previous seasons where the correct play was for the jungler to farm for 20 minutes?).

WRONG THE THREAD IN QUESTION HAD PLENTY

 >It relies on anecdotes and observation bias.

BULLSHIT.

replies.body:
Are you talking about "Quitting league till Jungle Xp is fixed"?

Yeah, I looked though that thread and there was pretty much only people yelling at each other.

> Season 9 jg was incredibly strong... you lost all credit complaining about season 9, when the jg role actually was super game changing.
> Couldn't even get 2 sentences in before lying. Every high elo JG says the role sucks.
> Jungle cant be buffed because it becomes a cancer onto everyone else, and you sir OP, are full of shit.
> I'll just dog roll you all with Zyra jungle until you figure out how to play it.
> Has it occurred to you that maybe you have no clue what balance is?
> Jungle fucking sucks.
> Again this is just factually fucking untrue.
> JG was trash in S9 LUL
> He's not 3 levels down. That's why he's good and you're bad.
> Yeah because NAs rank 1 jungler must be wrong too, and also must be bad at jungling, when he complains about the role?
> Have you considered you might just be bad at jungling? Pretty yikes to be 3 levels down consistently lmao. Unless you're just openly lying.
> see you never then. sorry.
> Tarzaned just comment on stream that jungle is in a terrible spot.
> Jungler XP is completely FUCKED.
> So when Junglers get to 1 v 2 at 5 minutes in game because they are a level over everyone again. K.
> Ah yes just remove sustain so one bad trade loses you the laning phase what a fucking great idea!
> Jungle is Absolute Garbage right now.
> A single gank gone bad with a decent enemy jungler ruins you.

I could go on, but 80% of the comments in that thread amounted to a "You're wrong! No, you're wrong" slap fight.

> [{quoted}](name=Ulanopo,realm=NA,application-id=6heBIhQc,discussion-id=bXNt48Fz,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2020-01-12T01:41:32.016+0000)
>
> Are you talking about "Quitting league till Jungle Xp is fixed"?
> 
> Yeah, I looked though that thread and there was pretty much only people yelling at each other.
> 
> I could go on, but 80% of the comments in that thread amounted to a "You're wrong! No, you're wrong" slap fight.

So let me ask mister mod. 

When someone says 2+2=5 am i not allowed to say that it's wrong? if the person responses with and says 2+2=5 again am i slap fighting with him when he is being told he is wrong. Also is "slap fighting" a technical term or are you "slap fighting" with me?

Is typing with emotion or flair against the forum rules?

Does typing with flair make a discussion about gameplay stop being about gameplay?

Why do you cherry pick comments out of a thread. Make up some bullshit 80% number that we both know is false and use it as a justification for deleting the whole thread instead of pruning or deleting comments? Or are you just to lazy to to your volunteer job properly?

I read that thread...so let me ask to counter that:

If someone adamantly agrees that 2+2=5, and you say they're wrong, what are you contributing? Obviously there's proof that 2+2=4.
However, there's always exceptions...there's actually a way to "prove" 2+2=5, mathematically, and even though we know it's wrong by any other standard, that proof does unfortunately exist. People broke calculus. Google it, i'm not shitting you.

The "slap fight" is essentially right here: I have just told you the proof exists...and obviously, you're correct that 2+2=4...but neither one of us are actually contributing jack shit here. It's going nowhere. This discussion is fruitless, and of course, completely off topic from the actual subject (why it's actually important that people know what math is, and suggestions for what to fucking do when things aren't correct)

As for your original topic...that's me being nice about it. Cause your actual topic was "I fucking quit, people suck at math" And that's not even attempting to facilitate a civil discussion...that's a rant. It belongs in Rant.

I petition Ulanopo to just start moving all these to RANT instead of deleting them, unless the name sticks out as someone spamming when they get moved. :P

> [{quoted}](name=ChaosReyn,realm=NA,application-id=6heBIhQc,discussion-id=bXNt48Fz,comment-id=000100000000,timestamp=2020-01-12T02:07:25.696+0000)
> 
> I petition Ulanopo to just start moving all these to RANT instead of deleting them, unless the name sticks out as someone spamming when they get moved. :P

We lack the ability to move threads.
RIP...was worth a shot.

> [{quoted}](name=ChaosReyn,realm=NA,application-id=6heBIhQc,discussion-id=bXNt48Fz,comment-id=000100000000,timestamp=2020-01-12T02:07:25.696+0000)
>
> I read that thread...so let me ask to counter that:
> 
> If someone adamantly agrees that 2+2=5, and you say they're wrong, what are you contributing? Obviously there's proof that 2+2=4.
> However, there's always exceptions...there's actually a way to "prove" 2+2=5, mathematically, and even though we know it's wrong by any other standard, that proof does unfortunately exist. People broke calculus. Google it, i'm not shitting you.

Googled but no luck. Link?

https://math.stackexchange.com/questions/775273/contradiction-prove-22-5/775274

It was a metaphor...but I don't simply talk out my ass. :P

They really did break calc for it though...not certain that's readable to most people. Shit, I can barely read it, and my uncle teaches that shit.

> [{quoted}](name=ChaosReyn,realm=NA,application-id=6heBIhQc,discussion-id=bXNt48Fz,comment-id=00010000000000010000,timestamp=2020-01-12T05:09:38.419+0000)
>
> https://math.stackexchange.com/questions/775273/contradiction-prove-22-5/775274
> 
> It was a metaphor...but I don't simply talk out my ass. :P
> 
> They really did break calc for it though...not certain that's readable to most people. Shit, I can barely read it, and my uncle teaches that shit.

Maybe read the whole thing, before saying it is proven. There's a link to another question that actually explains the  error in the attempted proof:

https://math.stackexchange.com/a/457492

> [{quoted}](name=ChaosReyn,realm=NA,application-id=6heBIhQc,discussion-id=bXNt48Fz,comment-id=00010000000000010000,timestamp=2020-01-12T05:09:38.419+0000)
>
> https://math.stackexchange.com/questions/775273/contradiction-prove-22-5/775274
> 
> It was a metaphor...but I don't simply talk out my ass. :P

That was the first result I found when Googling, but I thought that couldn't be the one you were talking about, because when you said "that proof does unfortunately exist. People broke calculus" it sounded like it was a _correct_ proof, perhaps in some really esoteric branch of math or something. However, the linked "proof" is no such thing. It's an attempt at a proof, and it is wrong. Nobody broke anything.

> [{quoted}](name=ChaosReyn,realm=NA,application-id=6heBIhQc,discussion-id=bXNt48Fz,comment-id=000100000000,timestamp=2020-01-12T02:07:25.696+0000)
>
> I read that thread...so let me ask to counter that:
> 
> If someone adamantly agrees that 2+2=5, and you say they're wrong, what are you contributing? Obviously there's proof that 2+2=4.

So your argument is if someone comes into a thread and shouts factually incorrect statements the thread should be delete? 

Do you really not understand how blatantly abusable and obviously terrible this idea is?

>Cause your actual topic was "I fucking quit, people suck at math" And that's not even attempting to facilitate a civil discussion...that's a rant. It belongs in Rant.

Wasn't my topic. That was also a clickbait title in the thread OP explained why after playing JG since s2 he no longer wished to continue playing it. Then a few of the forum warriors came in and started spouting false statments and saying nonsense response that weren't productive and factually false. Then the mods deleted it because  those few forum warriors came in spouting factually false info and picking fights with everyone. HAD ABSOLUTELY NOTHING TO do with the OP. So someone who spent a good amount of time writing a detailed explanation of why he doesn't like the current state of the game and was upvoted by like 80 people got his thread deleted because people that disagreed with his opinion came in and started "slap fighting". How is that fair to the OP? 

Also moving threads to Rant is deleting. Rant is a containment board, not a place of legit discussion.

> [{quoted}](name=Worst JG Wins,realm=NA,application-id=6heBIhQc,discussion-id=bXNt48Fz,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2020-01-12T01:52:30.779+0000)
>
> So let me ask mister mod. 
> 
> When someone says 2+2=5 am i not allowed to say that it's wrong? if the person responses with and says 2+2=5 again am i slap fighting with him when he is being told he is wrong. 

That's a straw man, as nothing under discussion in that thread was something that could be objectively proven. Now, before you say that jungle experience is demonstrably too low, keep in mind you have yet to offer any proof beyond [appeals to authority](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Argument_from_authority) (X jungler says jungle sux), [argumentum ad populum](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Argument_from_authority) (everyone says jungle exp is too low) or [anecdotes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Observer_bias) (I saw a game in which X happened). 

>Also is "slap fighting" a technical term or are you "slap fighting" with me?

Obviously it isn't a technical term, but a phrase I use when two or more people are arguing past each other. 

> Is typing with emotion or flair against the forum rules?

Again, hyperbole. Those things aren't forbidden, but they do often interfere with productive discussions. 
 
> Does typing with flair make a discussion about gameplay stop being about gameplay?

Depends on what you mean by "flair". When we review a thread, quality of discussion is an aspect we consider. Bickering, antagonistic responses and resorting to common rhetorical tricks and logical fallacies all reduce the quality. 
 
> Why do you cherry pick comments out of a thread. Make up some bullshit 80% number that we both know is false and use it as a justification for deleting the whole thread instead of pruning or deleting comments? 

I didn't prune it because the thread was beyond salvaging.

Let's look at your post here in DtB. In my lock message on the other thread, I posed a non-exhaustive number of questions I would consider relevant to a productive discussion on the issue of relative exp between lunglers and laners. Your reply to me answered none of them.

>BULLSHIT THE PROBLEM IS JUNGLE XP TOO LOW BECAUSE IT WAS NERFED AND TOP AND MID WERE BUFFED AND IT'S TOO HIGH CREATING A MASSIVE ROLE IMBALANCE IN THE GAME. THE PROBLEM DEFINE IS DEFINED. **WHAT YOU SAID IS A BUNCH OF BULLSHIT**

How exactly do you expect me to respond to that? Did you believe I would just roll over and accept your thesis? You seem to think that a bunch of capital letters are going to accomplish anything. I'm afraid that isn't the case.

>Or are you just to lazy to to your volunteer job properly?

This is an [ad hominem](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ad_hominem), by the way.

> [{quoted}](name=Ulanopo,realm=NA,application-id=6heBIhQc,discussion-id=bXNt48Fz,comment-id=000100000001,timestamp=2020-01-12T02:21:56.496+0000)
>
> That's a straw man, as nothing under discussion in that thread was something that could be objectively proven. 

False there is plenty of statements that are easily falsifiable. Such as "Top can't be level 8 while JG is still 5" 

This claim is false and this is a fact. Stop downvoting facts and lying

>Now, before you say that jungle experience is demonstrably too low, keep in mind you have yet to offer any proof beyond 

Every statement in gameplay is part opinion. Even those backed up with facts and statistics. No where did i state factually JG XP was too low i expressed it as an opinion. But it's like someone says it's hot outside and you say "hot" isn't objective blah blah blah ect and i say have you been outside.  You can't call something hyperbole when you don't even know if it's true or not.

> [{quoted}](name=Ulanopo,realm=NA,application-id=6heBIhQc,discussion-id=bXNt48Fz,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2020-01-12T01:41:32.016+0000)
>
> Are you talking about "Quitting league till Jungle Xp is fixed"?
> 
> Yeah, I looked though that thread and there was pretty much only people yelling at each other.
> 
> I could go on, but 80% of the comments in that thread amounted to a "You're wrong! No, you're wrong" slap fight.

https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/cquF58Jf-its-funny-how-jg-can-be-the-most-important-role-in-the-game-even-after-having-their-xp-gutted

Weird how the same type of thread of the opposite views gets to stay up with the obviously bot upvotes

> [{quoted}](name=Worst JG Wins,realm=NA,application-id=6heBIhQc,discussion-id=bXNt48Fz,comment-id=00010001,timestamp=2020-01-21T05:46:29.109+0000)
>
> https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/cquF58Jf-its-funny-how-jg-can-be-the-most-important-role-in-the-game-even-after-having-their-xp-gutted
> 
> Weird how the same type of thread of the opposite views gets to stay up with the obviously bot upvotes

Weird how stuff that hasn't been reported doesn't get removed... I took care of it, but really, what kind of person gets upset by a situation they created? You looked at that post and decided _not_ to report it, but got angry we hadn't removed it.

> [{quoted}](name=Ulanopo,realm=NA,application-id=6heBIhQc,discussion-id=bXNt48Fz,comment-id=000100010000,timestamp=2020-01-21T08:06:41.349+0000)
>
> Weird how stuff that hasn't been reported doesn't get removed... I took care of it, but really, what kind of person gets upset by a situation they created? You looked at that post and decided _not_ to report it, but got angry we hadn't removed it.

More than once lately I've had a mod tell me that there were no reports on a comment or thread which I reported several times. Just by the way there.

> [{quoted}](name=KFCeytron,realm=NA,application-id=6heBIhQc,discussion-id=bXNt48Fz,comment-id=0001000100000000,timestamp=2020-01-21T09:19:57.389+0000)
>
> More than once lately I've had a mod tell me that there were no reports on a comment or thread which I reported several times. Just by the way there.

That's a system thing. You need to make sure it changes to "reported".

> [{quoted}](name=Ulanopo,realm=NA,application-id=6heBIhQc,discussion-id=bXNt48Fz,comment-id=00010001000000000000,timestamp=2020-01-21T14:16:26.657+0000)
>
> That's a system thing. You need to make sure it changes to "reported".

I've done that. Whenever I refresh a page to see if it's been handled yet, if it hasn't, I'll report again. Seems like they just don't go through sometimes.

> [{quoted}](name=Ulanopo,realm=NA,application-id=6heBIhQc,discussion-id=bXNt48Fz,comment-id=000100010000,timestamp=2020-01-21T08:06:41.349+0000)
>
> Weird how stuff that hasn't been reported doesn't get removed... I took care of it, but really, what kind of person gets upset by a situation they created? You looked at that post and decided _not_ to report it, but got angry we hadn't removed it.

Really so the thread that i reported  multiple comments in wasn't "reported"

I guess the mods posting in the thread never actually saw it either

> [{quoted}](name=Worst JG Wins,realm=NA,application-id=6heBIhQc,discussion-id=bXNt48Fz,comment-id=0001000100000001,timestamp=2020-01-21T17:20:28.149+0000)
>
> Really so the thread that i reported  multiple comments in wasn't "reported"
> 
> I guess the mods posting in the thread never actually saw it either

You're welcome to believe whatever you want. I personally searched the queue, did not find that poster's name, reported the thread myself and lo! There it was.

> [{quoted}](name=Worst JG Wins,realm=NA,application-id=6heBIhQc,discussion-id=bXNt48Fz,comment-id=0001000100000001,timestamp=2020-01-21T17:20:28.149+0000)
>
> Really so the thread that i reported  multiple comments in wasn't "reported"
> 
> I guess the mods posting in the thread never actually saw it either

I have found that there is a limit to the number you can report in a certain period of time.  Sometimes if I find violations, I report them to make handling them easier, but only the first two I report go through after which I wait a minute, refresh, and report the others.  It's possible that if you reported multiple comments that only a few went through.
Tbh if you want these postd to survive, put them in General Discussion.

> [{quoted}](name=Caytheles,realm=NA,application-id=6heBIhQc,discussion-id=bXNt48Fz,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2020-01-12T02:26:06.399+0000)
>
> Tbh if you want these postd to survive, put them in General Discussion.

This is also true.

"X champ/role/etc. is OP how can Riot sleep at night X always gets fed and wins I hate X they need to be baleeted from the game" may be about something that happened while you were playing the game, but it's also a rant, and as such belongs in Rant. Repeatedly screaming "BULLSHIT" and writing every paragraph in caps doesn't make your argument stronger - in fact, it gives the impression that you have a tendency to make rant-like threads.

> [{quoted}](name=KFCeytron,realm=NA,application-id=6heBIhQc,discussion-id=bXNt48Fz,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2020-01-12T01:34:50.928+0000)
>
> "X champ/role/etc. is OP how can Riot sleep at night X always gets fed and wins I hate X they need to be baleeted from the game" may be about something that happened while you were playing the game, but it's also a rant, and as such belongs in Rant. Repeatedly screaming "BULLSHIT" and writing every paragraph in caps doesn't make your argument stronger - in fact, it gives the impression that you have a tendency to make rant-like threads.

You don't even know what the topic said and just assumed what it said, pretty much proves my point. You're dishonest and wrong.

> [{quoted}](name=Worst JG Wins,realm=NA,application-id=6heBIhQc,discussion-id=bXNt48Fz,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2020-01-12T01:40:58.046+0000)
>
> You don't even know what the topic said and just assumed what it said, pretty much proves my point. You're dishonest and wrong.

I see what the topic was about and it's not substantively different from the screed I gave an example of. You're free to think whatever you want of me, but that's not going to undelete your shitpost.
Cutting the bullshit would mean them actually deleting even more of the low effort garbage that plagues the Gameplay Board.

Riot needs to stop deleting forum posts and just lock them.

Deleting them shows they are hiding player concerns.

Also just because a post is negative does not mean it is NOT a legit gameplay issue and is CLEARLY to be posted in gameplay forum.
Banning people from the forum because they are following the rules just posting negative issues is NOT a reason to ban someone.

Mods delete them, not Riot. They don't work for Riot.

It doesn't hide anything when in most cases they tell you where it should be posted, as they don't have the ability to move them cause of their under developed board system.

Nothing new there. The boards are slowly becoming like League's subreddit where if you don't post something positive about Riot's dogshit e-sport scene, your thread gets closed and shut down justified by some made-up, imaginary reasoning. 

Jungle is trash and these mods are trying to hide it. They're just continuing the tradition with Riot employees that don't play their own game.

> [{quoted}](name=NumberOneBaller,realm=EUW,application-id=6heBIhQc,discussion-id=bXNt48Fz,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2020-01-12T02:07:47.626+0000)
>
> Nothing new there. The boards are slowly becoming like League's subreddit where if you don't post something positive about Riot's dogshit e-sport scene, your thread gets closed and shut down justified by some made-up, imaginary reasoning. 
> 
> Jungle is trash and these mods are trying to hide it. They're just continuing the tradition with Riot employees that don't play their own game.

Citation needed, cause last I checked disagreeing =/= not playing the game.
